camel.sink.path.cryptoOperation.name: camel.sink.path.cryptoOperation
camel.sink.path.cryptoOperation.description: Set the Crypto operation from that supplied after the crypto scheme in the endpoint uri e.g. crypto:sign sets sign as the operation. One of: [sign] [verify]

camel.sink.path.name.name: camel.sink.path.name
camel.sink.path.name.description: The logical name of this operation.

camel.sink.endpoint.algorithm.name: camel.sink.endpoint.algorithm
camel.sink.endpoint.algorithm.description: Sets the JCE name of the Algorithm that should be used for the signer.

camel.sink.endpoint.alias.name: camel.sink.endpoint.alias
camel.sink.endpoint.alias.description: Sets the alias used to query the KeyStore for keys and {link java.security.cert.Certificate Certificates} to be used in signing and verifying exchanges. This value can be provided at runtime via the message header org.apache.camel.component.crypto.DigitalSignatureConstants#KEYSTORE_ALIAS

camel.sink.endpoint.certificateName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.certificateName
camel.sink.endpoint.certificateName.description: Sets the reference name for a PrivateKey that can be found in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.keystore.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keystore
camel.sink.endpoint.keystore.description: Sets the KeyStore that can contain keys and Certficates for use in signing and verifying exchanges. A KeyStore is typically used with an alias, either one supplied in the Route definition or dynamically via the message header CamelSignatureKeyStoreAlias. If no alias is supplied and there is only a single entry in the Keystore, then this single entry will be used.

camel.sink.endpoint.keystoreName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keystoreName
camel.sink.endpoint.keystoreName.description: Sets the reference name for a Keystore that can be found in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey
camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey.description: Set the PrivateKey that should be used to sign the exchange

camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyName
camel.sink.endpoint.privateKeyName.description: Sets the reference name for a PrivateKey that can be found in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.provider.name: camel.sink.endpoint.provider
camel.sink.endpoint.provider.description: Set the id of the security provider that provides the configured Signature algorithm.

camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyName
camel.sink.endpoint.publicKeyName.description: references that should be resolved when the context changes

camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandomName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandomName
camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandomName.description: Sets the reference name for a SecureRandom that can be found in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.signatureHeaderName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.signatureHeaderName
camel.sink.endpoint.signatureHeaderName.description: Set the name of the message header that should be used to store the base64 encoded signature. This defaults to 'CamelDigitalSignature'

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize
camel.sink.endpoint.bufferSize.description: Set the size of the buffer used to read in the Exchange payload data.

camel.sink.endpoint.certificate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.certificate
camel.sink.endpoint.certificate.description: Set the Certificate that should be used to verify the signature in the exchange based on its payload.

camel.sink.endpoint.clearHeaders.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clearHeaders
camel.sink.endpoint.clearHeaders.description: Determines if the Signature specific headers be cleared after signing and verification. Defaults to true, and should only be made otherwise at your extreme peril as vital private information such as Keys and passwords may escape if unset.

camel.sink.endpoint.keyStoreParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyStoreParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.keyStoreParameters.description: Sets the KeyStore that can contain keys and Certficates for use in signing and verifying exchanges based on the given KeyStoreParameters. A KeyStore is typically used with an alias, either one supplied in the Route definition or dynamically via the message header CamelSignatureKeyStoreAlias. If no alias is supplied and there is only a single entry in the Keystore, then this single entry will be used.

camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey
camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey.description: Set the PublicKey that should be used to verify the signature in the exchange.

camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandom.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandom
camel.sink.endpoint.secureRandom.description: Set the SecureRandom used to initialize the Signature service

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: Sets the password used to access an aliased PrivateKey in the KeyStore.

camel.component.crypto.algorithm.name: camel.component.crypto.algorithm
camel.component.crypto.algorithm.description: Sets the JCE name of the Algorithm that should be used for the signer.

camel.component.crypto.alias.name: camel.component.crypto.alias
camel.component.crypto.alias.description: Sets the alias used to query the KeyStore for keys and {link java.security.cert.Certificate Certificates} to be used in signing and verifying exchanges. This value can be provided at runtime via the message header org.apache.camel.component.crypto.DigitalSignatureConstants#KEYSTORE_ALIAS

camel.component.crypto.certificateName.name: camel.component.crypto.certificateName
camel.component.crypto.certificateName.description: Sets the reference name for a PrivateKey that can be found in the registry.

camel.component.crypto.keystore.name: camel.component.crypto.keystore
camel.component.crypto.keystore.description: Sets the KeyStore that can contain keys and Certficates for use in signing and verifying exchanges. A KeyStore is typically used with an alias, either one supplied in the Route definition or dynamically via the message header CamelSignatureKeyStoreAlias. If no alias is supplied and there is only a single entry in the Keystore, then this single entry will be used.

camel.component.crypto.keystoreName.name: camel.component.crypto.keystoreName
camel.component.crypto.keystoreName.description: Sets the reference name for a Keystore that can be found in the registry.

camel.component.crypto.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.crypto.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.crypto.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.crypto.privateKey.name: camel.component.crypto.privateKey
camel.component.crypto.privateKey.description: Set the PrivateKey that should be used to sign the exchange

camel.component.crypto.privateKeyName.name: camel.component.crypto.privateKeyName
camel.component.crypto.privateKeyName.description: Sets the reference name for a PrivateKey that can be found in the registry.

camel.component.crypto.provider.name: camel.component.crypto.provider
camel.component.crypto.provider.description: Set the id of the security provider that provides the configured Signature algorithm.

camel.component.crypto.publicKeyName.name: camel.component.crypto.publicKeyName
camel.component.crypto.publicKeyName.description: references that should be resolved when the context changes

camel.component.crypto.secureRandomName.name: camel.component.crypto.secureRandomName
camel.component.crypto.secureRandomName.description: Sets the reference name for a SecureRandom that can be found in the registry.

camel.component.crypto.signatureHeaderNa.name: camel.component.crypto.signatureHeaderName
camel.component.crypto.signatureHeaderNa.description: Set the name of the message header that should be used to store the base64 encoded signature. This defaults to 'CamelDigitalSignature'

camel.component.crypto.basicPropertyBind.name: camel.component.crypto.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.crypto.basicPropertyBind.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.crypto.bufferSize.name: camel.component.crypto.bufferSize
camel.component.crypto.bufferSize.description: Set the size of the buffer used to read in the Exchange payload data.

camel.component.crypto.certificate.name: camel.component.crypto.certificate
camel.component.crypto.certificate.description: Set the Certificate that should be used to verify the signature in the exchange based on its payload.

camel.component.crypto.clearHeaders.name: camel.component.crypto.clearHeaders
camel.component.crypto.clearHeaders.description: Determines if the Signature specific headers be cleared after signing and verification. Defaults to true, and should only be made otherwise at your extreme peril as vital private information such as Keys and passwords may escape if unset.

camel.component.crypto.configuration.name: camel.component.crypto.configuration
camel.component.crypto.configuration.description: To use the shared DigitalSignatureConfiguration as configuration

camel.component.crypto.keyStoreParameter.name: camel.component.crypto.keyStoreParameters
camel.component.crypto.keyStoreParameter.description: Sets the KeyStore that can contain keys and Certficates for use in signing and verifying exchanges based on the given KeyStoreParameters. A KeyStore is typically used with an alias, either one supplied in the Route definition or dynamically via the message header CamelSignatureKeyStoreAlias. If no alias is supplied and there is only a single entry in the Keystore, then this single entry will be used.

camel.component.crypto.publicKey.name: camel.component.crypto.publicKey
camel.component.crypto.publicKey.description: Set the PublicKey that should be used to verify the signature in the exchange.

camel.component.crypto.secureRandom.name: camel.component.crypto.secureRandom
camel.component.crypto.secureRandom.description: Set the SecureRandom used to initialize the Signature service

camel.component.crypto.password.name: camel.component.crypto.password
camel.component.crypto.password.description: Sets the password used to access an aliased PrivateKey in the KeyStore.
